```{r starting}
#unpacking the libraries
library(dplyr)
library(corrplot)
library(GGally)
library(tidyverse)
#reading the data
human <- read.csv("human.csv", header = T, row.names = 1)

colnames(human)
str(human)
#exploring the relations
ggpairs(human)

cor(human) %>% corrplot()
```



```{r PCA}
#PCA
pca_human <- prcomp(human)
pca_human
biplot(pca_human, choices = 1:2, cex = c(0.8, 1), col = c("grey40", "deeppink2"))

```
```{r PCA_std}
#PCA for standardised data
human_std <- scale(human)
pca_human_std <- prcomp(human_std)
biplot(pca_human_std, choices = 1:2, cex = c(0.8, 1), col = c("grey40", "deeppink2"))

```

```{r MCA}
library(ggplot2)
library(FactoMineR)
tea <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/KimmoVehkalahti/Helsinki-Open-Data-Science/master/datasets/tea.csv", stringsAsFactors = TRUE)

pivot_longer(tea_time, cols = everything()) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(value)) + facet_wrap("name", scales = "free")
```

```{r}
mca <- MCA(tea_time, graph = FALSE)
plot(mca, invisible=c("ind"), graph.type = "classic", habillage = "quali")

```
